channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: New Recipes from The Kitchn
item.description:
How perfectly lovely would that Lemon-Blueberry Yogurt Cake look on your table? If it's cookies you're craving, we have three contenders to vie for your oven space. And am I the only one who wants to steal a quick spoonful from that Banana Cream Pie?

• New Recipes from The Kitchn
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Top Tours of the Week — March 25 - 29, 2013
item.description:
There was a lot of little in this week's tours, from a bright studio in downtown San Francisco to a 550 square foot home for two in Brooklyn. But that's  not all — we also featured a rustic cottage in Laurel Canyon and a live/work home in Seattle. Check out all these homes and many more in this week's Top Tours. 

• House Tour: Amy's Light & Bright Small Space
• House Tour: Joan and Matt's Joyously Eclectic Home
• House Tour: Jonah & Jodie's "Enchanted Cottage" in Laurel Canyon
• House Tour: Clayton + Kate's Stylish Abode
• House Tour: Jennifer's Designer Touch for a Spanish Style Home

• House Tour: The Duplex, Right Side: Jean & Dylan's Playful, Working Hideaway
• House Tour: Mark’s Urban Architect's Loft in Seattle
• House Tour: Behind the Seams at the House of Hunter and Harper
• House Call: Michelle, Rob & Kaia's True Antique

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Renovation Diary: What's New This Week — March 25 - 29, 2013
item.description:
Seth and Allison have new walls. Andi picked out some truly lovely new colors, and Claire and Jeffrey installed drywall, and even began assembling new cabinets. In each of our three projects, you can begin to see a new kitchen taking shape. Check out the progress and read the stories in this week's Renovation Diary. 

• Seth & Allison's Kitchen: The Walls Go Up
• Andi's Kitchen: All the Pretty Colors
• Claire & Jeffrey's Kitchen: Drywall is Happening
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Weekend Project: Organize Your Books — Apartment Therapy Video Roundup
item.description:
Books. We all have them, we all love them, but sometimes it can start to feel like they're taking over your life. What do you do when a beloved collection gets a little out of control? Here are three videos from our archives that will help you get a handle on your books. 

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Dye It, Buy It & DIY It: Ultimate Easter Craft Roundup
item.description:
After a long winter, Easter comes around just in time to brighten things up. Whether you have kids or not, dying eggs and decorating the house is a great way to welcome Spring. Here are 22 posts to help you embrace your inner Easter Bunny this weekend. Hop to it!

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Inspiration Gallery: Jaw-Dropping Bedroom Details
item.description: This post is all about gasp-inducing details - elements that stop you in your tracks, take your breath away and, in one fell swoop, transform an ordinary space into an extraordinary one. More

item.title: DIY Utility Bucket Ottoman — Design Sponge
item.description: I am in awe of people who can look at the humblest of objects and turn them into a beautiful, functional piece. Design Sponge featured this ottoman DIY built around a generic hardware store utility bucket. More
item.author: Kim Lucian

item.title: Charming Portland Rentals from Our House Tours — Renting Done Right
item.description:
Though our house tours span the country, as well as the globe, today we're focusing on Portland, Oregon, where the homes are as diverse as the people who live there. Here are ten inspirational homes from renters in a place known for its rain, coffee, and book stores (among other things).

More
item.author: Liana Walker

item.title: Benjamin's Dressed Up Fridge — Renters Solutions
item.description:
Benjamin sent us in the pics and info on his renter-friendly fridge update. It's a completely temporary fix that dresses things up nicely and can come with you when you move. Jump below to read about how he pulled off this look...
More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: Love Your Appliances? Tell Us Why!
item.description:
If you own and love a particular refrigerator, range, oven, or dishwasher, or just covet a particular brand or model, we want to know what it is and why!

• Love Your Appliances? Tell Us the Maker & Model!
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Get A Bird on It: 10 Bird Feeders & Houses
item.description:
My husband and I have been working on overhauling our small city backyard since last summer. The biggest chunk of the work has happened already, and I've been imagining all the finishing touches. Besides thinking a lot about plants, my mind has gone to the birds.

More
item.author: Kim Rinehimer

item.title: The Weekend Guide: March 29, 2013 — National, Local & Online Sales & Events Calendar
item.description:
You may find yourself chasing the Easter bunny or overindulging on a basket full of candy this weekend. Or, you could check out our sales and events list to find deals for sprucing up your own little bunny hutch this weekend. Check it all out in the Weekend Guide, pass it on and be sure to send us your own sale or event.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Michelle, Rob & Kaia's True Antique — House Call
item.description:
Name: Michelle, Rob & Kaia
Location: New Milford, Connecticut

We (me, my husband Rob, and our 6-year-old daughter Kaia) are scroungers and DIYers. Our style is rustic, eclectic, and kind of modern, with a few traditional elements mixed in for contrast. When we started house-hunting back in 2002, we had a clear vision of what we wanted: a '50s or '60s ranch that we could gut easily to customize in our own style. Instead, we ended up with a true antique! 

More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: Bedroom Retreat Roundup: A Gallery of Art Above the Bed — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
We've noticed many of our favorite submissions from My Bedroom Retreat showcase an array of artwork situated above the bed. Paintings, graphic prints, oversized photographs, and even decorative sculptural pieces...they're all a crown to the head of where we slumber. But in the process of gathering up some of our favorites, we noticed half of these artfully arranged entries came accompanied with furry companions comfortably situated below (including a pillow which almost passes for a pet)...

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: Treat Yourself: Little Bits of Spring
item.description: I live in a northern climate, where snow is still thick on the ground, and there is no sign of spring. In fact, here in Minnesota, we could easily see a snow storm at any point until the first week of May. I've find myself longing for spring, so it's time to find ways to keep it alive in my head while Mother Nature sleeps in. More
item.author: Mari Richards

item.title: Using Lighting to Define Space — Renters Solutions
item.description:
Many renters (and equally, non-renters) face the all-too-common problem of having to cram a whole lot of living into, well, not a whole lot of space. We have dual and sometimes multi-purpose rooms: living, eating, working, and maybe even sleeping within one open-plan space. And since our homes are becoming more and more open-plan, most of us are likely to have to deal with this issue at some point, even if  we're not currently living in lofts or studios. 

More
item.author: Eleanor Busing

item.title: Help Me Find Less Expensive Version of Collins Sofa? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I'm in love with the Collins Sofa by Restoration Hardware, but it's not really in my budget, which would ideally be less than $2000. Do Apartment Therapy readers have any ideas for a similar sofa? I like the relatively clean lines, the warm leather, the size and the fact that it is a sectional. Our apartment living room is very small, but we have a sectional this size and shape now (a cheap upholstered one which is falling apart after 5 years) and it works well for our lifestyle. Alternately, if someone can talk me into saving up $6000 for a Restoration Hardware sofa, I would like to hear your rationale for that! Thanks, guys!

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: In Search of the Perfect Family Coffee Table
item.description: If you've ever shopped for a perfect coffee table for a family with kids, you know how difficult this can be. Our coffee table incarnations have evolved from none to soft pouf to kids' table, and now we've settled on a glass table because it's so easy to wipe down. And yet, even though my kids are getting older, it's still a hazard. So what is the perfect solution? I've rounded up a few potential candidates, but would love to hear your thoughts. More
item.author: Elisabeth Wilborn

item.title: How To Install a Nest Thermostat
item.description:
Things have changed since we last gave a how-to on installing a new programmable thermostat. Namely, a little thermostat called Nest hit the market. A smart, self-learning thermostat that you can control via a smartphone. The elegant and clean design of the Nest even trickles down to the installation and setup process. We give you the full step-by-step for installing your own in this how-to.

More
item.author: Chris Perez

item.title: Joan & Matt's Joyously Eclectic Home — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Joan Hiller and Matt LeMay
Location: Williamsburg, Brooklyn, New York
Size: 550 square feet
Years lived in: 1 for Joan, 2 for Matt; Rented

We first met Joan when she was living in this stylish studio in Portland, so we already knew about her phenomenal sense of individuality and style. Knowing this, it's not surprising that upon moving to New York, she would meet and fall in love with someone whose creative energy parallels her own. Together Joan and Matt have put together a home filled with charm, personality and love. 

More
item.author: Liana Walker

item.title: Friday Favorites: Brass Whippet, Serigraph & Dresser — The Friday Afternoon Scavenger
item.description:
It's the end of the week, which means my list of favorites from our Classifieds. Have a wonderful weekend, and happy scavenging!
  • Chicago, IL: Brass Whippet Sculpture - $285
  • Tarrytown, NY: Mid Century Dresser - $595
  • Venice, CA: Kantha Throw - $150
